meanings.def: the amount of something that can be held in one hand
examples: She scooped up handfuls of loose earth.
She bent and pulled up a double handful of weeds.
She grabbed handfuls of the dirty snow.

meanings.def: a small number of people or things
examples: Only a handful of people came.
They cannot hope to win more than a handful of seats at the next election.
We have received only a small handful of letters on this subject.
She has a good handful of (= several) Hollywood roles under her belt.

meanings.def: a person or an animal that is difficult to control
examples: Her children can be a real handful.
